definition: double standard
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
accurate/standard/definitely/certainly/about to become (bride, son-in-law etc)/quasi-/para-

sentences.english: Nothing suggests the need for a double-standard.
sentences.chinese: 沒有采取雙重標準的必要。

sentences.english: China firmly opposes applying double standards on the counter-terrorism issue.
sentences.chinese: 中方堅決反對在反恐問題上採取“雙重標準”。

sentences.english: China and US both guilty of double-standards.
sentences.chinese: 中國和美國都有搞雙重標準的過錯。

sentences.english: Personal complicity and double standards are the nails in the coffin of our ability to lead.
sentences.chinese: 私下同謀和雙重標準是領導力的棺材釘。

sentences.english: Doesn’t that seem like a double standard?

sentences.chinese: 可這就是奧威爾雙重標準。

sentences.english: But Wexler recently accused the Turkish prime minister of having a double standard.
sentences.chinese: 但是，韋克斯勒最近指責有雙重標準的土耳其總理。

sentences.english: The West has a double-standard approach toward human rights.
sentences.chinese: 西方在人權上一貫採取雙重標準。

sentences.english: The powerful countries adopt double standards to fix intricate international issues.
sentences.chinese: 強權國家採取不公正的雙重標準操作複雜的國際問題。

sentences.english: But there is frustration in Berlin at what are seen as British double-standards.
sentences.chinese: 英國雙重標準的玩法確實激怒了德國。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
misconception/fallacy
to both be willing/mutual consent
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
lit. first impression is strongest
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
original identity fully revealed (idiom); fig. to unmask and expose the whole truth
to do whatever one pleases
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to force someone to do something
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
